alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Louisa County through 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Louisa, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Mineral, Boswells Tavern, Pendleton, Louisa Airport, Green Springs, Byrd Mill, Trevilians, Wares Crossroads, Cuckoo and Yanceyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
